intro: Crudia glaberrima, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
